user_review: I have had a couple people recommend this place for when we are in Montreal so I made a reservation ahead of time (seating for the bar area which is fine!). We were a few mins late but the host was able to sit us at the bar ahead of time. Our waiter was very welcoming and explained how the menu worked since it was both our first times there (chefs menu vs. a la cart items). He even offered to make us a specialized cocktail based on our taste. For food items we decided to Get the octopus appetizer and both of us wanted the halibut for dinner. Our drinks came out first and mine was delicious! My friend actually ended up like my drink more than hers so she traded her drink in haha. The octopus came out first and omg it was delicious. The octopus was tender and seasoned well. The garnish paired well with the octopus and we basically scraped the dish clean. Next our halibut came out and had this anchovy cream over it. I was afraid the anchovy taste would be overpowering but it was actually super delicious! Halibut cooked perfectly and the potato cake under the fish was also absolutely delicious. Overall with our great service and food/drink this was our best meal in Montreal :)

I had the best dinner here during my last trip to Montreal. They offer a tasting menu or you can order a la carte, and they do take Amex unlike most other restaurants in Montreal .We had oysters to start, they were all east coast, salty but super fresh and lots of flavor. We then had the tuna carpaccio, which was delicious, and we split the hanger steak. The sauce on the hanger steak was super peppery but I liked it a lot. They had really great glasses of wine, and the meal overall for the amount of food was super reasonable. I will definitely be coming back next time I come!
Very tasty foie gras melting in my mouth. Canard de maison with squash purée was too good to even finish. I wanted the taste to last forever

My first visit to a Chuck Hughes restaurant and it was great!! The service was absolutely awesome. The guys at the bar made me feel more than at home. Thank you again!!The shrimp hush puppies were super delicious with a honey sauce. my next favourite dish was the mushrooms with gorgonzola cheese, great flavors.I also had the scallops with gnocchi which I thought was tasty but overly salty. The scallops were cooked to perfection. Just don't expect too much in terms of the amount of gnocchi,  they were sparse on the plate. To finish it off, I had the brownie with white chocolate mousse, a very sweet and decadent dessert, even for me and I'm a chocolate lover.And team Chef Chuck Hughes or Chef Bobby Flay, you ask? (Iron chef circa 2011- YouTube it)I say Chef Hughes!!

Sometimes the hype around a restaurant kills the actual experience of being there.  This is probably true of Garde Manger.  Food was fine but the experience did not meet the raving reviews that I had heard.We made a reservation in advance but ended up in a corner booth which was not comfortable.  The idea of not having a menu bothered some of the folks in the group but I was cool with the idea of reading off the black board.Service : Our waitress was phenomenal!  She was efficient, funny and kept the conversation going as we placed our orders.  Definitely a highlight!Food : We tried a lot of appetizers - portions were small which led us to order more.  For an entree, I tried the pork tenderloin with jalapeno grits which was the only dish i really liked.  The rest of our group tried their different offerings - seafood, steak.  Food tasted good but the overall experience did not live up to the expectations.Ambience : For a fine dining restaurant, our table for 5 was too cramped and we did not enjoy it.  The restaurant is highly sought after and is crowded at all times.  Its not easy to find the restaurant since they do not have a sign upfront.  Its an unassuming door and just follow your GPS.Pricing : Expensive.  Don't mind paying the price as long as there is value in the experience.Will I return? : Maybe, to entertain.

I love family style menus and this restaurant does this perfectly. Their seafood platter is really more like a seafood TITANIC that spans three feet and is filled with incredible delights such as oysters, smoked fish, mussels, razor clams and caviar, and lobster. This course alone gave the restaurant 5 stars in my mind.We had so many dishes, all of which were great, but some stand out in my memory:- Boston bib salad with blue cheese- Salsify (this is a root vegetable, which I had never tried before but am now a convert)- Beef tartare- Scallops and gnocchiI would pass on the hush puppies (which reminded me of falafel) and the liver mousse on bread. Desserts were excellent. This restaurant has a very "Montreal feel" to it - a warm and cozy escape from the cold outside, bustling with friends enjoying good wine and food. Highly recommended.

I am completely obsessed with Chuck Hughes. Whenever he's on tv, I watch him. I've got a Google alert set up to read anything anyone has ever written about him. I've watched every episode of Chuck's Day Off, Week Off, Eats The Streets--religiously, hoping for the day that I'd be able to visit Garde Manger and possibly taste the famed lobster poutine.According to the internets, you have to have a reservation newly a month in advance. I was traveling in Montreal sooo, so I took a chance and arrived at the restaurant right before 5 p.m., hoping to snag a table just for myself. The restaurant has no signage or street number posted on the door. It's almost as if you have to "be in the know" to know exactly where it is. Due to construction on the street to prepare for the 375th anniversary of the city, it was even that much more difficult to navigate past open holes in the street and narrow passageways to get there. Lucky me: there was ONE seat at the bar (where I prefer to eat anyhow) and the bartender took good care of me. I went in for poutine and stayed for the lovely, bustling atmosphere. There is one menu but it's written in chalk on two boards, in French and in English. I read Yelp reviews that said to stay away from the poutine because it wasn't worth the hype, but I didn't listen and I'm glad I didn't. It was one of the best dishes I've ever had at a restaurant. Being a Southern lady, I am well-versed in the language of gravy and the gravy is what made the poutine spectacular. There was PLENTY of fat, succulent pieces of lobster and the curds were melted just slightly under and on top of the piping hot pommes frites. I had a glass of wine and happily wobbled my way back to my AirBnB.For anyone contemplating going to Garde Manger, do make reservations and do get the poutine. It says market price on the menu and don't let that scare you away. It ended up being ~$15 CAD.

waited 40 minutes for our reservation, BUT the server did make it up to us with complimentary champagne!I had the zucchini pedals which was beautifully deep fried and had a nice flavour. For the main I went with the duck with the seabuckthorn which was very bitter but still delicious, I would've licked my plate clean! The service was mediocre as the server seemed very irritated with the dinner guests. We could've leave without dessert, and we got the bread pudding with the pumpkin cheesecake (huge yum)!!!!

Simply fantastic!  We did the chefs tasting menu and each dish was better than the previous!  The seafood platter was a beautiful variety of oysters, mussels salad, shrimp, lobster (pic attached). We had a great tomato salad which was made from tomatoes from their garden. The scallops were perfectly seared and omgggg dessert!  The blueberry cheesecake, yummmm!
The gentleman at the front host podium was rude, snooty and unfriendly. That alone put us in a bad mood. I wouldn't go back.

Food 5 stars. Ambiance 3. Amazing multi course tasting menu for 4. It was ideal for us since we were unable to collaborate on which of dishes we wanted because all of it looked great. Menu is on a chalk board... not idea in a dark restaurant. We started with a beautiful seafood tower. All dishes were served family style but perfectly made for 4 (so there was no fighting over our servings). Arctic char, scallops, halibut and rib eye were my faves. Dessert was also delicious. All of it was amazing. The old negatives: it's very dark. For such beautiful food, it's not idea for the visual part of the meal. Our waiter was over zealous and interrupted convos often. And my biggest complaint is that it's WAY loud from the music, to the point that you are telling the whole time. My throat was sore the next day. Not good for conversation with the other guests. If the meal wasn't so perfect, I would absolutely drop stars.

Walked in on a Saturday night for a few drinks with a friend after eating at another restaurant nearby. We were seated at the back bar as the place was obviously busy; all tables were full as was the bar in the front of the restaurant. I've eaten at this restaurant and can say that the dishes are great; the market fresh menu displayed on a chalkboard is simple, creative, and just plain tasty! Tonight though, we wanted cocktails and Garde Manger delivered! The service was friendly, the ambiance was buzzing, and the space itself is cozy and relaxed for a fine dining restaurant. The cocktail mixes were good and one as interesting as the next; I could have easily kept going but stopped at two I would definitely return for the food again, especially their seafood plates as the menu is ever changing; our bar mates servings sitting next to us definitely opened my appetite!

We got last minute reservations here and the food was just outstanding! Would recommended to anyone who would want to visit and have dinner in the old city of Montreal! We ordered oysters which were phenomenal and the burrata was unforgettable! Please try this restaurant you won't regret it!

Party of 2, Wednesday night, 930pm. Very very pricey. Luckily the food is pretty good, so that helps you get over it pretty quickly.Very dark and loud space.  We sat at the back bar and that was with a reservation.  WARNING: they are quick to sell you on a seafood platter, but much slower to tell you the cost of that platter - they charge you for EACH item they serve you, so it gets expensive very quickly.  Make sure you ask how much it's going to cost you.  Otherwise, our seafood platter was delicious - oysters, lobster, ceviche, sturgeon, shrimp, mussels.  Very fresh and came with a ton of condiments.  Beef carpaccio had waaaaayy too much olive oil on it.  Soaking wet.  But the beef was fresh and tasty. The homemade pasta was amazing. Melt in your mouth I would order two the next time I went back kind of amazing.Our last dish was a fish dish that was very blasé.  Lots of ingredients piled on top and made the overall taste mediocre.  Service was fantastic though, they are good sales people.

Fantastic Dinner! I booked a seat a month in advance (Saturday of a long weekend it was needed!) Very worth it! The food was great and the staff was amazing and helpful with explanations! My only con... the discontinued lobster poutine was a let down! I was really looking forward to that but no dice! Actually looking up menus ahead of time is a downfall as it does change! Which is good to keep food fresh and new but also disappointing when you're like me and like to decide on what to have ahead of time!

Love this place so much. One of my favorite restaurants on earth. Every time I visit my friend in Montreal I make it a mission to come and eat here. My favorite thing on their menu is the razor clams but anything that they serve out of that kitchen is going to taste like pure bliss. The restaurant is very pricey but you definitely get what you pay for over here. The inside of the restaurant is really nice and has a very lively atmosphere during the dinner rush. Also the servers here are just as incredible as the food.

When I came to this city, I had an expectation of what the perfect dinning experience in Montreal should be. A quaint restaurant situated in Old Montreal. An inviting atmosphere, with a warm fireplace to take the chill out of the air. Excellent food with plenty of variety paired with the impeccable service of experienced professionals. I can honestly say, that Garde Manger exceeded all of those expectations. The interior is picturesque, the service exquisite, and their food is nothing short of incredible. This place has the best oysters I have ever had in my life. They are a must have, if you are going to dine here. Having food of this caliber, so early in my life was a real privilege. Yet I'm tortured knowing I might not have a dining experience this great again. 10/10 would go back
Food, atmosphere and staff were truly amazing.Thank you to Alexander and Simone for making our first night in Montreal a spectacular one.  We will be back...maybe before we leave in 2 days.

Amazing! David, our waiter, was incredibly friendly, helpful and perfectly attentive. The host was also very friendly and helpful in finding us a table despite not having a reservation (which I advise making, if possible). The food was also incredible. We started with the octopus and Brussels sprouts appetizers, which were delicious. For entrees, the steak and halibut were both great. That was plenty of food for two hungry diners!Definitely check this place out when in Montreal!

ohh this was such a polarizing experience... here we go...we sat at the bar which I always like bc you get to see the bartenders in action. The bartender was very helpful with telling us about the menu. You dont get paper menus here just have to look at the wall and pick what you like.I started off with an old fashioned which was solid. The wine was also good. No complaints here.We ordered a few appetizers as well. We had some of the sturgeon tartare and some other raw preparation that the bartender suggested. Both delicious. We shared the pork as an entree. It was tender but a tad salty for my taste. The jalapeno grits were a good compliment and overall it was a balanced dish.For dessert we had this little donut type things with peanut butter/chocolate. I forget the name but they only had 2 options so we gave it a go. Wasnt the best dessert I have had but pretty good.This is where the review gets tricky. We had great service for about half the meal but all of a sudden the bartender did a 180. He literally went missing and then dropped the check before we were done eating. The bartenders mood changed for no reason... We werent milking our drinks or anything but it felt like we were being forced out. Very weird. It put a bad taste in my mouth about the whole experience. Food was great albeit a little salty. Dont force people out who have come a long way to visit and this place will be fine. Until then it is a 3 star place.

Poutine and lobster were a match made in Heaven, and the angel in charge of solemnizing the match was named Chuck Hughes. Now, these are facts that the clergy and the texts will not tell you, so you just need to eat the lobster poutine at Garde Manger to be blessed with such divine revelation. I showed up without a reservation at 7:30 PM on a Friday night (what was I thinking?), and was told that it would be 10 PM before I could get seated (at the bar!). I actually ended up getting seated 10 minutes before 10 PM (score!). No, I did not wait around at the restaurant for upwards of two hours; I just provided my name and phone number, and went out for a walk around the lovely city of Montreal on the beautiful summer evening. The daily menu is scribed onto a couple of chalk boards (one in French and the other in English), and the only two items that are constant are the lobster poutine and the jerk spiced crab. Everything else changes regularly. Some nights, they have more exciting items, such as Cornish hen stuffed with foie gras, or a foie gras and short rib waffle; other nights, it's more familiar items, such as Arctic char and walleye. The lobster poutine, in my view, lives up to the hype. The mildly fishy succulence of the lobster claw meat pairs very nicely with the cheese curds, fries and gravy. I noticed that one of the reviewers here thought there was barely any lobster in the poutine. I have to suspect that his dining companion must have stolen all of the lobster when he was not looking, because there really is a very generous amount of lobster on every serving of the poutine that I have seen here. The desserts also change regularly, and my favorite is the peanut butter and nutella profiterole, which is a rich confluence of sweet and salty flavors and smooth and crunchy textures. Service is absolutely outstanding. Everybody is extremely friendly. My server, Awesome Alexander, recognized me from a prior visit to the restaurant (I can't imagine how, given the sheer multitude of people dining here every night), and brought me a sweet gift of complimentary dessert (or, to continue with the theme of divinity, heavenly manna)!

This is the second time I come here, I honestly have to say that my experience got better the second time around! Service is exceptional! I came here with my love and we love our oysters. We got a dozen oysters. They easily slide out of the shell and directly in my mouth. Yummmm yummm just remembering it gives me the goosebumps .. I wished I had some right now!! Lol. I had a beautiful meal last time except for the octopus .. I have to say it was not their best meal! The cook was overcooked and it turned out super chewy. It was even very cold. Kind of surprised that it was overcooked at a top executive restaurant owned by the famous Chuck Hughes!! Hmmm bummer. Ok on the pro side Their Mushroom risotto was succulent warm and freshly prepared. I had to order a second order of that amazing risotto! Another thing I don't like is how their menu is written on their board. It's so small I can barely see what they have and theres absolutely no bright lights in the resto. It's kindove a drag having to figure out what the hell is on their menu. I admit its hard to get a hard copy of their menu because they change it daily but maybe they should change their board to a light board with markers instead of the dreadful chalk board. Service was splendid! We always get amazing service over here. I think the manager knows us very well and he always makes sure to get us the best available table and makes sure to get us the drinks we ask for. Overall, it's a very fancy gem in montreal and these minor détails could be totally corrected if they pay attention to these comments hopefully! :pI do recommend this place for their amazing service.

I came to Montreal for a couple weeks and decided to have a "Treat yo' self day".  I went to Garde Manger on a whim but I didn't have a reservation.. they sat me anyway. Afterwards I experienced some of THE BEST customer service I have experienced anywhere. I NEVER had to ask for water every single server refilled my water the second they walked by and noticed it was empty. The bartender and sever who waited on me were incredibly friendly and helpful to guide me through their menu. I had a delicious dinner that was worth every penny and on top of that a bartender gave me a suggestion for a great local bar in the area. I had such s great time at Garde Manger! I highly recommend you make a reservation and experience their quality for yourself!

My friend and I randomly found this place walking by, and they were able to accommodate us for a pairing menu that evening. We had to wait a few house so went walking and had an appetizer nearby, and our table was ready when we returned. The food was unbelievable, as was the service! I wish I had gotten more pictures to remember what we go, but we were too focused on eating at the time! This is a must if you are in the area- yes it is pricey but you will remember the experience for a long time!

There was no reservation available for the night I was in town and coincidentally stumbled in to this place for a drink one night because I thought it looked inviting. The host told me that he would make two seats available for us at the bar if we came the next night. So accommodating! We did the tasting menu and I have to say I'm not a seafood fan and I found the seafood platter to be the BEST thing I've ever eaten. Definitely stepped out of my comfort zone and it paid off. Everything was so fresh and 6 months later I am still dreaming about the razor clams and the smoky seafood salad.  The staff was so friendly and even let us request our entrees for the tasting menu which typically is the chef's choice. Had great conversation with another couple at the bar that comes to this restaurant every time they are in town.

I had been curious to visit Garde Manger for a while because of the Chuck Hughes connection, and my wife and I used to watch a lot of Food Network. But we live in Toronto, so when we were in Montreal recently I made it a priority to make it here and book a reservation way in advance. If you want a two person table this is definitely needed as they only have a few two person tables. If you don't land one of those then you'll find yourself at the bar which is I'm sure fine. Food is food. Drinks are drinks.The chalkboard menu is ever changing and makes you know you are only eating seasonal stuff. We ordered a couple apps. My wife had the asparagus which was in season and quite delicious. I had the shrimp salad which was good, as it had good flavour, but maybe not as interesting as some other things and I regretted my choice. My main was the artic char and chorizo which I thought was a slam dunk flavour wise, though a bit tiny for a main. Though very pretty. My wife had the spaetzle which she enjoyed. Who doesn't love spaetzle?We had sponge cake with ice cream for dessert that looks and sounds simple but it was out of this world. Maybe my favourite part of the dinner. Simple things done exceptionally well always rule supreme. It was a delicous dinner but I feel like there is better value out there.

I have been to Garde Manger several times and it does not disappoint. It is located in Old Montreal. The restaurant does not have a sign so you will need to know where you are going. The restaurant is dimly lit and intimate. The exposed brick walls adds character to the place - gives the restaurant a trendy vibe.   The food is delicious and is worthy of the hype. There are a few standouts. I would recommend starting a caesar (which comes with) and some oysters.  The oysters were expertly shucked, meaty and fresh.For the mains, we enjoyed the signature lobster poutine, the pasta and duck. The lobster poutine consists of french fries, lobster meat, cheese curds, and lobster bisque reduced until it takes on a gravy-like consistency. The lobster poutine is a must. There is a reason why it is a signature dish. I would recommend getting a the small size as it is really filling. The pasta with rabbit meat was delicious. The duck was flavourful and cooked medium rare. Garde Manger and Chef Chuck Hughes are Montreal institutions. I highly recommend Garde Manger.

Where do I begin? This is my fourth timing eating at this establishment over the past several years. Not sure when they decided to try and up-sell every customer through the door, but they are very quick to try and push you toward the chef's tasting menu...which starts at $110/pp. They call that the "minimum", but for an "other worldly" experience we can get "very creative" for $140/pp.Don't get me wrong the food is good, but prices have skyrocketed while portions are relatively small. That, coupled with the pushy nature of the servers is a complete turn off!The wine list, while fairly extensive is grossly overpriced! Our server, Simone, while very knowledgeable, was very abrupt and almost seemed perturbed that we wanted control over our menu!If your looking for a place with decent food, a bloated wine menu, and a huge bill, this is your place. Many better options in the area!

Probably should have ordered more seafood but we ended up with more of the other dishes.The beef tartare and ricotta were my favorites that we had. Did not like the chestnut tortelloni and pork tenderloin. The scallops and the mushroom toast were just ok.A cozy, dark restaurant with the menu on one chalkboard. Our server was very helpful and attentive.

Loved this restaurant! We had such a fantastic experience - we sat at the bar and were cared for by Simone. First course = oysters - super-fresh, with a lovely cocktail sauce with fresh / shredded horseradish and mignonette. My husband the pork loin and I asked for a surprise and received scallops (delicious!). We split a side of polenta and mushrooms that stole the show. Absolutely delicious. Simone curated lovely wine pairings throughout for me; my husband loved the beers on offer - a discerning and delicious list. All in all, a special night. Thank you!

Pretty place, and conveniently located near the old port. That's where the positive review ends: they discontinued the famed lobster poutine, the bartender had a tense and pretentious manner, she made very mediocre cocktails, and strangely insisted that the tuna tartare they served me (I ordered ceviche) was in fact ceviche (the server even called it tuna tartare when she brought it over --see photo). Annoyingly, they also had no physical menu, just a chalk board. Weird and unpleasant experience. So many great places to eat in Montreal at this price point and lower. Save yourself the trip.
Very good food. Watch out they will up sell you and not really tell you the price of things. We ended up leaving over $300 for a dinner for two.
Omg the food and the employees are awesome. I absolutely will be back! I had the duck and pork tenderloin and we had the beef tartar for a app then dessert and it was all amazing!!!!

Food was amazingly good! Went for a work event. Loved everything! Especially the appetizers! How do their brocolis taste that good? Scallops were cooked just right! Crispy on the sides and tender on the inside. Wonderful.Great waiters and great service! Will go back!

This was one of our most exceptional meals in Montreal. We passed by on the first night and couldn't figure out what it was..bar, restaurant?  Thankfully I did a little sleuthing to figure out that the pink light up sign was the entrance to deliciousness. We had to eat LATE (I mean like 10:30pm) because we didn't plan ahead but it was well worth it. The atmosphere is dark and cozy and it was perfect for the cool weather outside. We were seated all the way at the back of the restaurant - which was great because we could check out what everyone was eating on the way. The menu isn't huge but it is well selected and with a variety of items for everyone. I had fish and I have to say that it was the most well prepared fish I have ever eaten. Fully cooked (as requested vs seared) and still so tender and not dry at all! The server was very friendly - and helpful since I had a lot of menu questions. Definitely worth a visit and even a 2 hour wait for dinner. I will plan ahead next time to eat earlier but will definitely return!

Went here for a company event and though the place seems low key the bill can really add up. We had the tasting menu for the group which was 100 per person and the food was fantastic.   Started with the seafood platter and everything was fresh the horseradish sauce was nice and tart the oysters were tame but flavorful.   The main course were too many to count from steak tartare, to the scallops ravolli to the fried cheese balls.  The dessert presentation was excellent and all of them were delightful.   Overall a good experience and the bar tender was super helpful.  Worth a visit.

Some of the best oysters I've had in the East Coast. There's technically no "menu" here besides a board on the wall with their seasonal dishes written down but they are known for their build your own seafood platters - ask the servers for more info! Would highly recommend the build your own seafood platter

Wow. My family and I had a spectacular dinner here. Although the menu was pretty meat-heavy that evening (I believe the menu changes frequently), our wonderful and helpful waiter gladly guided us through the several pescatarian possibilities for us. We most loved the tomato bread soup and the salmon entree, although the one of us who eats meat raved about the duck as well. We could've passed on the desserts, but otherwise a flawless meal at not too exorbitant a price for the area!

Start playing Tina Turner's Simply the best! Took a splurge and went for the 5* $500 experience! Took the $140 per person chef special and...oh my (insert adjective) GOD! From the entrance to the exit everything was on point! Everything was excellent. The waiters were helpful and great. I have nothing negative to say other I need more! Not cheap but plenty of food! When we reached the desert I was full. So this is not an expensive experience that leaves you hungry! I totally recommend and yes book a month ahead of time to guarantee an orgasm in your mouth!

Sat at the bar. This was a first stop of a 5 night trip.I eat out a lot. This place has it all.Great service The food was fabulous.. Everything First time here "I'm hungry how about you just surprise me with whatever you think is good"First was a platter of fresh seafood AMAZINGLYThen a few other plates The flavored and the freshness WOWHey this place just hit everything just right

My partner and I went to Garde Manger for dinner while we were visiting Montreal, and overall, we really enjoyed the food and service here.We had heard about this restaurant through various food blogs, and understood that the chef is on TV. We were able to get a Saturday night reservation at the bar about five days beforehand. The restaurant itself is very small and you can see everyone from the bar. There was a very inviting and intimate feel to the place. The menu was very eclectic, with different spins on normal dishes. We opted for some Canadian oysters, which were delicious. However, one of them was just bad - happens to anyone and it's not a bad reflection on the kitchen - but then they brought us out more oysters and genuinely seemed to care whether our food was to our liking or not. I think that kind of attention to detail is what sets this restaurant apart from a lot of other ones.We also opted for two appetizers, which were delicious, and for our entrée, we decided to split the most luxe option that they had - a Cornish hen stuffed with foie gras. It sounds decadent, and it was. There were lots of complex flavors with that dish, and I definitely liked the dish.Overall, we really enjoyed our meal at Garde Manger. It was probably our favorite meal in Montreal, and that's saying something because there are a lot of great food options here.

Disappointing. Inhospitable. Food was tasty but small portions, relatively expensive and painfully slow to the table. Stupid chalkboard menu and ineffective waiter descriptions/communication. Received Garde Manger recommendation from fellow diner at Michael Smith's Inn at Bay Fortune on PEI. We had high expectations for our one night in Montreal but left deflated. Garde Manger needs some hospitality training from Danny Meyer.

I come to Montreal at least 3 times a year, and every time I go I stop in to Garde Manger.Food is always top notch and delicious. I will say I did visit on March 16 and the waitress we had was not the best (although the food was amazing). My whole party knew what we wanted to order, however she insisted we just start with a drink order- fine.I wanted the steak, however I dislike mushrooms so asked if I could have it with out mushrooms and substitute it for fries. She said she'd ask the chef, she eventually returned and said it was fine, however neglected to inform me she would be charging me for them. I don't see why she would have to check with the chef if she intended to charge me. Also, about 20 minutes into waiting for our food (she did tell us it would be 40 minutes which was fine) we had to request the bread and butter. Normally every other time I have been here (has to be at least 6 times) the waiter always brings it out.Regardless of the poorer service then normal, the food was outstanding and I will continue to come back. My bill after tip was around $100.00 just for me.

The food was delicious, but the sales practices left a bad taste.I expected a big bill.  Appetizers are between $15 and $20 and entrees around $40.  We also had cocktails and wine.Our very charming, but very fast-talking, server at the bar talked up the seafood platter.  He encouraged us to allow him to put together a platter for us which, together with two appetizers and one entree, would be roughly the same amount as two appetizers and two entrees.When I got the bill, it was higher than even I was expecting.  But one doesn't like to make a fuss, and one has had a cocktail and some wine, so one pays the bill gracefully.When I reviewed it later, however, that seafood platter totalled $68!  Almost double the cost of an entree.As I said, the food was excellent, although the entrees are on the small side, but I would have preferred more honesty in the selection process.  The take-away is to tell your server how much you'd like to spend on the seafood platter before you receive it.

This place was what I was hoping it would be and more. I had watched a YouTube video prior to my trip, on the food network where they featured garde manger. The meat looked unbelievable and i knew my husband and I had to check it out.On opentable, it does not allow you to make a reservation more than 30 days in advance for this restaurant. I booked exactly a month in advance and still only received 2 bar seats. It ended up being a wonderful evening. Located in Old Montreal, this restaurant is not labelled so look for the numbers on the side of the building.I loved the ambience of the restaurant. My husband ordered the pork chop, which was out of this world! Prior to this, another guy was there with his wife and was raving about the pork chop, saying this was the best pork chop of his life. My husband and i would have to agree!!! I ordered the duck confit which was also amazing! Super succulent. I do have to say all the food is very rich and filling so we were definitely slowed after that meal. We also started with the shrimp hush puppies, which were phenomenal and we highly recommend them.I would love to come back here again the next time I'm in Montreal!

So much fun, something often lacking a upscale meals. The food is great, perhaps not high end 'gastronomy' or trendy ingredients which is fine by me, but everything was delicious, the highlight being the best duck I've ever had.But the 5 stars is for the whole experience. Amazing rustic room, perfect light, fun music that was loud enough but not too loud, and great vibe from staff. Sat at the bar and had a great night out. Would return in a heartbeat.

Overall a great experience. We originally had a reservations late in the evening. At the last minute we ended up getting tickets for the Nasty Show and called to see if we could change our reservation. David was very understanding and accommodating. Without hesitation he promptly made the change. On our way to dinner we got stuck in traffic. Wow! Construction and driving in Montreal is an experience in and of itself. We again called to let them know we were going to be late (and to see if we could still make the reservation) and explained the situation. Again, they were very understanding and told us not to worry and that our table would be waiting when we arrived.  We arrived for dinner and were promptly seated. Everyone from the host to wait and bar staff were very polite and friendly. Alessandro was our bartender & server. He was attentive and explained everything very clearly and gave suggestions based on our tastes. I started we the lemon meringue cocktail. Yum! How can you go wrong with Tito's and limoncello!?! We started with the ricotta lobster stuffed zucchini flowers. Delish. They were served with a pickled salad of zucchini and shallots with mint and basil. I had the halibut risotto for dinner which was also very good. My spouse had the hanger steak with pomme frites. The steak was divine and the fries were super crispy. We ate at Joe Beef the evening before and my spouse enjoyed his steak at Garde Manger more than his aged beef he had time night before (it was also very good.) There was even a little hiccup/mishap with our appetizer and the wait staff was very apologetic and it was promptly taken from the table with our plates and cutlery. It was replaced a few minutes later, again with an apology. Our water glasses were never left empty and the service was great. The music was very chill and enjoyable, we were even singing along with Alessandro. I would highly recommend to anyone!
Fantastic. Sat the back bar with Dave who was incredible. Food was out of this world. Oysters were over the top. Staff was so friendly and nice. Best restaurant in Montreal

Loved Garde Manger! I wanted something French-inspired while in Montreal, but desperately wanted to avoid stuffy, white table cloth French restaurants common to many American cities. Garde Manger felt younger but timeless, and I really appreciated the general vibe, probably helped by a great bar and cool chalk-board menu. Fries are a must-order! Overall, easy and good quality food.

We went to Garde Manger for double birthday celebration and all the seven of us were quite happy with the experience. The ambiance of the restaurant was warm and welcoming. The service was good and our needs were attended timely. We sat in the inner hall at a cosy big table under the menu. The same menu is written on the black board and it has only the appetizers and main courses, drinks and desserts are announced by your host and I really prefer to read the ingredients of what I'm consuming.The lobster poutine is amazing and believe me there is enough lobster in it. I had tomato salad for appetizer, which was not less amazing as the tomatoes were sweet like they have grown under the southern sun or may be the chef had some secret seasoning for them. My main course was the most expensive dish in the house, lobster risotto, but wow, it was freakin good. As my friend wisely explained, when you pay for risotto you don't pay for ingredients, but for work and experience. I managed to dig in the duck with  mousse of foie gras dish and it was pretty good too. The sweet potato creme brûlée was interesting dessert to share, but next time we would rather try something else. All drinks we had were solid. The girls fell in love with the Bloody Caesars, they still talk about them more then a month later. I was a little bit disappointed as the Caesars didn't come with the famous snow crab leg in them, just a massive fresh celery and some beef jerky instead. Now I need to come back for more Bloody drinks with the famous legs, this time I really would like to sit at the raw bar and try some fresh seafood. Conclusion this is one more place rated solid five stars on my personal scale of six. I find it overall expensive, but absolutely worth trying!

My wife and visited Garde Manger June 29th. I must say the the food was excellent. As for the portions I cannot really evaluate them as we were served many different dishes. Each had interesting mixes and flavors. It was well prepared and presented. My wife and I are not major foodies and did not go here for the reputation but rather the type of food. We are also not overindulgent eaters. So why the 3 stars? Our food server told us about several meals/specials stating they would typically be plus or minus $40 let's say. Then he flowed into describing a combo meal with a little taste of everything for $110. All of the foods sounded good so we said sure we will do that. Then while we were waiting I told my wife "I will bet you it is $110 per person". She asked and it was. We went ahead and got the meal and it was excellent. Worth $110 a person?  Maybe. Does a single person need that much food? NO! I heard the same presentation given to 3 other couples and it was the same. 2 others got what we ordered and I don't know if they were surprised like us or not. Way to deceptive for my blood. I have been in sales for years and it was a pretty slick transition from $40p/p to $110 with no mention that was p/p. Enjoy the excellent food but get everything clarified!

What a disappointment! My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on our first night in Montreal. It took us a while to find this restaurant because they pretentiously didn't have the name of their restaurant visible.I ordered the drink of the day and my boyfriend had a beer. The drink of the day was delicious and I was happy that they weren't stingy with the alcohol.We ordered three appetizers to share: the famous lobster poutine ($19), grilled octopus ($19) and fried cod and clam ($16). My boyfriend complained that there were very little lobster in the lobster poutine and I couldn't agree more. I think I took the only piece of lobster and he was left with the bits and pieces. The fries were decent but I think I like Deville Dinerbar's fries more (especially for that price point). The grilled octopus was also done well and wasn't tough at all. However, it was nothing special to my palette. The fried cod and clams was the the worst dish because all I tasted was batter.The downfall of the night was when the host rudely confronted us because of a reservation confusion. We called earlier in the night to inform them that we would like our reservation pushed back and they nicely did it for us. Unfortunately, the person taking our call made two reservations under our name. That's why the host confronted us about the second reservation. I didn't see why he had to be so rude toward us when it wasn't our fault and the restaurant wasn't even busy (it was 6pm).Overall, we had a mediocre experience and I expected more from this restaurant.

Our dining experience at Garde Manger was absolutely exceptional. Everything from the ambience, the service (one of the best parts!) and, of course, the food made our night a 5/5.To begin, the restaurant is found in old Montreal, nestled amongst various other places to eat and grab a drink. Although there is no sign that explicitly says "Garde Manger", it wasn't hard to find. As we entered the restaurant, we were met with the sounds of people talking and laughing and delicious smells emitting from the open kitchen. The room was dimly light, creating an intimate atmosphere. And although there wasn't much music playing when we first arrived, towards the end of the night, the restaurant turned up the music and played everything from Queen to Salt n Pepa! (We were pleasantly surprised and very impressed). We were seated at the bar and we were helped by a bartender named Loris. Loris was attentive and fun, he kept making sure were ok throughout the meal, chatting with us and even recommending places to check out afterward. He made our experience very enjoyable and we couldn't have been more happy with his service and expertise.Loris helped take us through the menu and we decided to go with the Chef's tasting menu as per his recommendation. After asking us if there were any allergies or food restrictions, he informed us that the tasting menu included 4 courses: a seafood platter, a second and third course (each of these courses had three plates, served tapas style) and finally dessert. After we finalized what we wanted to eat, Loris recommended that we tried the Negroni (his favourite) and then we ventured off to try the Caesar and a Montreal cocktail that I can't remember the name of. The drinks were smooth but strong and we were very happy about that. We began our meal with the seafood platter and believe me when I say this was some of the best seafood we've ever eaten. My boyfriend, who doesn't even like fish, enjoyed everything that we were given. The platter includes crab, oysters, cocktail shrimp, and a selection of a pâté, ceviche, smoked herring and pickled muscles. It was the best way to kick off our dinner and definitely our favourite course. Next we had our second course which was a chicken liver pâté on a crostini, cornbread hush puppies with shrimp and a beet salad. Everything here was so fresh and savoury, and we couldn't imagine how it could get any better. The third course included duck breast (melted in your mouth and was topped with a zesty reduction), poached halibut which was so creamy I couldn't believe we were eating fish and finally a gnocchi with Quebec cheese and a garlicky, crunchy topping to add texture. Everything was just as delicious as the previous course and we were barely able to finish everything! Finally, we finished everything off with a chocolate and peanut butter tart, homemade chocolate cookies (which were to die for) and puffs with mint ice cream covered with a fudge. To finish this very lengthy review, I highly recommend checking out Garde Manger and trying the chef's menu. You will not be disappointed!

Went to Garde Manger on the first evening in Montreal with my sis and one of her close friends. We were in town for NYE. My sister found GM and secured reservations, and I'm so glad she did! The reason for my five star review is because this spot hit all points of a great dining experience - awesome food, customer service, and atmosphere. Like I said, there were three of us having dinner and we opted for the dinner special that included four courses at at a flat rate of $80 per person. The first course started off with a cold seafood plate that included fresh raw oysters, smoked mussels, scallop, and salmon. A basket of fresh bread and butter flavored with spicy honey came to the table and was the perfect accompaniment to the fresh seafood. Second and third courses were three appetizers (small plates) and then three different dinner dishes. All were chef choice and they were awesome! My favorites included roasted beets over creamy ricotta, tuna tartar, and a creamy risotto topped with crunchy breadcrumbs. And final course was dessert which was a fresh, out of the oven berry crumble pie and caramel puff cookies. As I mentioned, as good as the food was, the experience was also about things that didn't go in my mouth. The service was immaculate and the feel of the space was really warm and inviting, especially crucial given that we arrived in the middle of a major cold spell (minus 15 degrees outside that night). The music playlist was great, and the night ended with a string of hip hop favorites that got us dancing in our seats. I am so glad we made it to Garde Manger! I can't say enough good things about this spot and encourage you to check out this quaint spot in Old Montreal!

My friend and I went there last week. Beautiful restaurant, great service, food it's good. The portions are very tiny and expensive. I had a good time but I will not come back to this restaurant again...over rated to expensive. Make sure you eat something before you go to Garde Manger, otherwise you will leave hungry.

Like most of my group, we went with high expectations based on the fact that is Chef Hughes restaurant and he's an Amazing Canadian talent!   This place is hidden away, no signs, so stay sharp and aware when finding it.  We made reservations as we know this place can get busy.  We were greeted promptly, seated and started our first round of drinks.  Our waiter in the beginning of the night was attentive (great wine recommendations) but unfortunately that service didn't continue.  We did the chefs tasting menu in order to try as many cool dishes as we could along with recommended wine pairing.  The waiter recommended a white with my appetizer that went so nicely.  We had a variety of raw fish such as scallops attached to the shell (pretty cool) oysters, and other varieties.  The BEST appetizer which alone would be a 5* was the beef carpaccio.  A MUST order item as so fresh and delicious!  The scallops were like butter, really enjoyed them!  We also were served a braised pork but unfortunately it was full of fat so only 2 people in our 4 person group could taste it.  During the course of dinner, our waiter was missing in action, serving tables around us and while we were attempting to get his attention we really didn't exist and it was surprising as it wasn't a crazy busy night.  I would have drank a lot more wine (only had 2 glasses) as no one was there to take our order.  The guys in our table had to order from the bar as we were very neglected.  All in all I'm happy we did it however was disappointed with the experience.

This was easily one of the best meals I've had - the service was outstanding and the flavours and textures of everything were spot on. They were so accommodating of my need for gluten free. And I was certainly not limited on what I could eat. We sat at the bar and had reservations for 6:45. We arrived just before our reservation and were seated promptly. The service was excellent - food runners, bar tender, host. They have the restaurant run as an art. My husband and I shared 4 different dishes then ice cream for dessert. Endive salad with apples, pecans and blue cheese - light and tart. Smoked sturgeon cubes with creams fraise, chives  and caviar - wow wow wow. Salmon with Nordic shrimp, chorizo vinegrette and a cucumber, dill and red onion salad. The salmon was a pacific wild salmon, cooked perfectly. The heat of the chorizo complimented the tart acidity of the cucumber salad that complimented the richness of the salmon and shrimp. Taking a forkful of every element of the dish gave the perfectly balanced palate. Pork tenderloin with mushrooms, jus and a smoked cheese and jalapeño grit. This dish was all rich but it worked. The smoky spicy flavour of the grits with the perfectly cooked pork had my husband declaring that this was his favourite meal and favourite restaurant. We finished it up with a scoop of the blueberry vanilla ice cream - made in house and an excellent palate cleanser and end to the dinner.

I used to love watching 'Chuck's Day Off' (I think that's what it was called) so when hotel concierge was able to get a last minute table on Saturday I jumped at the chance. Fun location in Old Montreal, nice size for an intimate, if somewhat loud, dinner. Service is very attentive and graceful - waiter knew all the dishes by memory, custom built a dish for a friend and took no notes for our order. Good wine selection but prices at the upper end $$$$ ( figure about $100/bottle)Fish is the reason to go. Get the fish. Extensive 'raw' selection of oysters etc for apps. We all went with salads - beets, horseradish and ricotta for me. Very fresh, well seasoned and nicely pickled beets.I had the scallops for dinner. Perfect hard sear on the scallops and perfectly done to 'medium rare'. Nicely accompanied with smoked tomato, lemon and a few other nice things.Leave room for dessert - key lime pie in a jar is worth it as is the ice cream and profiteroles.

A meal to end all meals.     We went with the tasting menu and oh my, the food was good and plentiful.      The fried capers on top of tuna was my particular highlight, but it was all good.      Even enjoyed the duck of which I'm not normally a fan.
One of the top Montréal cuisine! Cozy ambiance, good service and delicious food! Lots of choices of seafood! Menu change often so always a good surprise. Highly recommended!

This place is quite popular. The only reservation time available was for 9:30pm. We came in an hour early to try our luck. No luck. I wasn't that crazy about the hostess lady. Being the first person you greet, she wasn't very friendly. On the other hand our waitress was super nice and very friendly. The food. We had an octopus dish. Superb! Best octopus I've had so far. On the other hand we tried the lobster poutine. Total fail. Small portion of lobster and the fries reminded me of McDonalds. So I found that dish to be a waste of calories and money. We also ordered the scallop dish. I liked it. Great fresh taste. I

The place didn't live up to the hype for me. The server was quick to show up and really tried to sell the seafood platter, which was good but everything was charged separately so the price adds up (just tell them what you want), the razor clam was my favourite of that. Main course, I got the halibut or cod (dont remember) with the baba ganoush, which was very good. The service was very disappointing though, the host was not welcoming and the seafood platter took 45 mins to come.

Went with my boyfriend on his first trip to Montreal. Had the tasting menu, the chef selects dishes from the daily board and sends them out, along with their signature seafood platter. Was a really amazing and interesting way to experience the food. The portions were almost full size for each course, so we were stuffed silly by the end of the meal. Excellent experience and service.

The host was very rude and dismissive when we asked about the lobster poutine. He snapped at us that they haven't had the lobster poutine in over three years and that most tourists "don't look at the dates of photos and reviews"; meanwhile other reviews below note enjoying it as near as 11 months ago.

Great ambiance, fantantic service and AMAZING food. So glad I managed to get a reservatiom thru the DINR app. Had the ahi tuna, raw scallops, hanger steak with zuchinni salad, scallops and charred corn, and housemade peanut butter and chocolate hazelnut spread pastries. Good way to wrap up our Montreal stay. Worth every $$ spent.

Came here cuz its popular and it's one of Chucks establishments.  Even though reviews were a bit mix but I'm that shallow that I need to try a Canadian celebrity chef place :)  we came here for appetizers only because we had reservations for another delicious place down the street. So we picked what we wanted the most at this place which was seafood platter and the octopus. I love lobster but just not a poutine fan, so didn't want to waste good lobster on a pile of fries and gravy. And glad we didn't get it. Lady sat next to our table ordered that as her main and was not impressed with it either.  I see it used to have 1/2 portion n full portion options on the board from other yelpers photos but when we went, there's only the $28. Seafood platter!  4 kinds of oysters which were all fresh and delicious. My fav is the fresh scallops on shell and that's what'd drawn me to this place. They didn't have snow crab that night unfortunately. We also had the smoked salmon on beets salad place. It's yummy but I think $10 for that tiny plate is a bit much. The grilled octopus with potatoes and chorizo cream was delicious. The octopus was cooked perfectly, not rubbery. And potatoes and garnish were good. Although a tiny lack of seasoning. Those were the only things we had. Seafood platter and octopus. No drinks. And $82 later. Guess seafood platter is $$$$. Although good seafood and rare scallops on shell. Don't think it's worth the price on appetizers along.  Food is good and definitely on the pricey side. Wouldn't give 5 star rating because the value just isn't there. There are many much better restaurants in Montreal for way way better food and lesser price. But if you're just loaded with cash, I'm sure the food here will satisfy you regardless.

Razor Clams. So good. Cauliflower. Epic. We checked out 'beefier' places in Montreal but this absolutely stole the show during our food-and-drink-focused week in the city. The dishes were very flavorful but more importantly balanced and the wines had a good range of midst and pricey. The service was excellent and the service was genuine, the team was slick and a lot of fun. Ask the maitre'd for some "Baby J's" after dinner or maybe the upgraded, sophisticated version.
Fantastic meal.  I loved sitting at the bar and chatting with the staff! The tasting menu is 100% worth it

Came here on a Saturday evening with my boyfriend. We tried making reservations online 5 days prior and according to opentable there were no tables available for us until the following Tuesday; we called the restaurant directly and they were able to accommodate us. Main takeaway: Overpriced tasting menus.Tasting menu is $100/person and consists of the following:3 oysters3 different pates 1 razor clam 3 appetizers tasting portion not full size 3 entrees tasting portion - not full size If you are with a group and can't be bothered to study the menu on the chalk board on the wall then it is good to try the tasting menu. Otherwise it is cheaper to order items individually.

I always thought Garde Manger was good but after our recent meal there it's ascended into the ranks of the Montreal greats. Their seafood platter is among the best I've ever had, the lobster, razor clams and oysters are phenomenal (if standard), but it's the various smoked fishes and other tasty bits really bring it to the next level.  Service is insanely good, informal and friendly but so very on the ball. We did the tasting menu with wine pairings and we never had an empty glass once, the food showed up at the same time for everyone, and despite the restaurant being packed our server never felt like he was rushing with us. Mains included an incredible pork shoulder on cheesy potatoes that sounds boring but made me make a sex face in front of my mother in law it was so good. Most of their food is like this - on paper nothing special but through ingredients and preparation elevated to superhuman levels. Not sure what's changed recently but it's a different restaurant than last time I was here a year ago. Only nitpick is that around 10 on the weekend the bar fills up with friends of the restaurant and things get pretty party. I'd be pissed if I spend $500 and had to deal with people doing shots, yelling at each other and standing around with their butts in my face (we were a table over from the action so had a buffer) - but that's part of the ambiance - they also play 80's hair metal and gangster rap, sometimes that's just the price you gotta pay...

Last year we went to Le Bremner, another Chuck Hughes restaurant in Montreal, and had a great experience. As a matter of fact I swore I saw Steven Spielberg there although my husband said I just needed my eyeglass prescription checked because there was no way he'd be eating dinner at like 6 PM wearing a pair of shorts. So needless to say I had high hopes for this place.We were able to weasel a last minute early bird reservation at the bar. It was actually perfect, a spot in the back, quiet and intimate but seated at the bar you feel like you're in the middle of the action. They initially forgot to bring us bread, eventually I asked and boy am I glad I did. There were 3 different kinds of fresh bread that were each equally delicious and filling.We fell prey to the tourist trap that is the lobster poutine. Sorry but honestly it's overrated. Fries lack another dimension of flavor, were soggy, the gravy watery and the lobster felt wasted on this dish. I'd skip it, they had many other delicious apps on the menu.My main course was the red snapped served with green beans, mushrooms and lobster. I don't quite know how to describe it. It was crunchy, flavorful, light and delicious.My husband got the short rib with aged cheddar grits and a parsley salad. The beef was heavenly, tender, and fell off the bone without a knife. The cheddar grits were the best I've ever had. His dish was the highlight of the meal.Ambiance is trendy but not pretentious. Romantic and intimate. Waiters are friendly. Sure it's a little pricey but isn't that worth it if there's a small chance you might run into Steven Spielberg.

We got lucky.... This was a last minutes trip but we were trying to book about 2 weeks ago.  They were fully book but we went to try again since plan changed. Lastly we got to a last minutes cancallation at the bar for just an hour.  We ordered some seafood (oysters, scallops and razor clams) and a mushroom toast as appetizer.   Season selection as great and the best it the freshly graded horseradish was amazing.  The 2 hot sauce that they paired was a hiden gem.  Specially the one called the holy hot sauce; it was chunk's own sauce.   It was well balance with jalapeno and the acidity.  I bought one home and my parent said it goes with meat better than seafood. We got 2 main course: pork loin with mushroom and salmon with squash.  The loin is one of the best I have ever had.  Soft in the middle paired with buttery oyster mushroom.  The salmon is great but we find the it is a bit too sweet for us.  An advice is to order a bit more than your regular order.  Their portion is a bit small.

Could not have had a more pleasant dining experience. Welcomed enthusiastically by the host. We were supposed to only have bar seating but were placed at a  very nice table.  The food taste and presentation kept getting better through the courses. We had the birrata and coquettes as appetizers and the were divine especially the pistachio sauce.  Hanger steak with fabulous sauce also. Duck was amazing.  We had to try dessert which is not typical for us and were  not disappointed.  Must go in old montreal

Had high expectations for this place, especially having finally watched the episode where chef Chuck Hughes defeated Bobby Flay on Iron Chef and having gone to the Bremmer were we had an amazing dining experience.We shared 5 appetizers, the clams, the bison tartar, the octopus, the lobster rolls and the lobster poutine.Everything was good but nothing was spectacular or made we want to continue ordering. The lobster poutine was original and they were definitely generous on the lobster serving but it wasn't the best poutine I've ever had.The octopus was somewhat dry, the lobster roll lacked seasoning and overall that wow factor you would expect at a place like this just wasn't there.Especially when considering the price, it just wasn't worth it.Probably won't be going back again.

Oh this place blew me away. It is very hard to get a reservation here so my boyfriend and I decided to go at 9 pm on a Tuesday night and managed to get a spot at the back bar. We had a blast.The atmosphere can not be beat. Dark and cool. Now for the food. I had oysters from Nova Scotia that were crisp and so beyond fresh. I decided to treat myself to a raw scallop that was still on the shell. You can't get that anywhere! So impressive. Then the main event. The LOBSTER POUTINE. okay if you are going to get poutine, go hard and get lobster poutine. It's as good as it sounds. Huge portion with large chunks of lobstah with a buttery gravy sauce with melted cheese curds over fries. Need I say aything else?The service is 10/10. Everyone is very nice and are open to making suggestions. Loved the vibe and I love this restaurant.

I'm not sure how this place is only a 4 on Yelp - it's 5 stars all the way. We've been here twice - September 2016, October 2017. Ate at the bar both times, were looked after by Sam both times, had fabulous experiences both times. The food is beyond amazing. We never made it to the entrees on either occasion - the craft-your-own seafood platters are simply too good. Razor clams, mussels, turbot ceviche, smoked Arctic char, oysters, lobster, scallops - amazing, just amazing. And when you add perfectly charming service by Sam and his associates - I can't think of a more delightful way to spend an evening. We will be back and we will be asking for the bar and for Sam.

Went there for a drink after a night out at a restaurant with a group of friends ...i loved the vibe that this place has..its a bit loud but totally understandable for a popular spot as this oneI liked the open kitchen and the friendly staff.!!Am definitely going back for a meal and drinks .!!!

The Canadian Chardonnay was tasty and reasonably priced.  Our server took great care of us with a super friendly personality. Shared the raw beef appetizer special and the pan roasted salmon with roasted green beans. All tasted super!!!!!!The restaurant is small with high energy and the noise level a bit high. The only glitch that evening was it appears the kitchen hood was not working properly so you left smelling a bit oily. I would return to Garde Manger again.
Delicious food and great, hospitable service. We had the seafood platter, scallops, halibut, hangar steak, and veal pasta - all great! I loved their use of fresh ingredients.

Garde Manger is a classic Montreal restaurant in beautiful Old Montreal. I've always had a great time at Garde Manger. The atmosphere is energetic but not too loud. It's a fun place with amazing food. The service is attentive. Seafood platter is the best in the city. Can't wait to return. P.S. It's expensive, but worth it.

How this place doesn't have any Michelin stars is beyond me. The food is exquisite- the freshest seafood, oyster. The seafood tower is a sight to behold and worth splurging for. Razor clams, scallops, lobster, etc. we also had a perfectly cooked duck breast w/ blueberries, hazelnuts and fried beets. So good! The wine was the perfect chilled temperature (I despise room temp red wine). The service was top notch. The atmosphere is low lighting and the music was a riot - 70's, 80's & 90's. You must go! A+

I had been looking forward to my visit to Garde Manger my whole trip in Montreal.  It did not disappoint!I sat at the bar, which I'd highly recommend, as the service is superb!The bartender presented me with the drink menu, however when I informed him of my preferences, he offered to make a drink for me.  I was happy to take this option, and the drink was fantastic.  I did this the remainder of the meal, and all four drinks I had were terrific, and just what I wanted!I started my meal with the seafood platter.  I opted for oysters, lobster, and the smoked char.  It was all fresh, and divine.  And just enough for me.Following the seafood, I decided to just have an appetizer.  I chose the pork belly.  I loved it!Dessert I had a hard time deciding between the strawberry shortcake and coffee cake, but decided to go with the strawberries since they were in season.  Perfect finish to my meal.The service and food here are fantastic.  It's a little loud, so if that bothers you, it might not be your place.  Personally, I enjoyed the energy.  I'm already panning my next trip.

Our best meal in Montreal - ever. Without question a must try when in Montreal and strong recommendation to make reservations well in advance of your visit. Use Bookenda to make your reservation or of course you could call them. Have the lobster poutine as a shared appetizer and save your main meal for one of the entrees they have on the board that night. The stuffed hen is big enough for two people and although I only had a small sample I will order for next time. I had the short rib and was blown away by how good it was. Leave some room for the ice cream sandwiches.....and also ask to have a picture taken with the kitchen staff. Well worth the money spent.

Absolutely fantastic service. We were in town for two short nights and we're lucky enough to meet someone who pulled strings for us to snag a spot at the bar for a late-ish Sunday reservation. The space is dark and moody. Gorgeous. We were actually able to sit at a table in the back dining room. We shared some razor clams and Arctic char from the raw bar. We had an amazing curry spaghetti squash appetizer (easily the highlight of the night), a lamb shank and a delightful sponge cake dessert. The misses were the lamb shank, which was served at a room temperature and the fact that I felt there should have been bread or something to accompany many of the plates and sauces. With a bottle of wine, our meal came to $185 CAD. I would return.
Stumbled upon this bar one night and they told us they have dinner service so we popped in the next evening. Amazing food and drinks! Great atmosphere as well!!!

Another great place to eat in Montreal! The staff is amazingly helpful and descriptive with their menu items to help you choose your perfect meal! My aunt and I thoroughly enjoyed this venue!! Highly recommended by the "foodie-gal" of the States!!!

Waited so long to try this restaurant, it's really hard to get a reservation. We went there because we watch Chuck's day off and we heard so much about his poutine that won Iron chef that we had to tick it off our food bucket list. First, we waited 45 mins before they take our orders. Waitress apologized and said "Sorry it's friday night so we're reaaaally busy." OK? Did this place just open a week ago or what?? Its a freaking restaurant of course its busy on FridaysLobsters are not in season and we were informed by the waitress that the price would be 36$ Since we really wanted to try it we went for it...when the poutine came, our jaws just dropped. I mean- Why would you charge much higher than the regular price and bring just a normal poutine with literally 6 pieces of curd cheese and tiny bit of lobster on top...just why...and seriously there was maybe just 2 tablespoon of gravy poured on it. Its okay to charge 36$ for a lobster that is not in season but to charge and bring no lobster is a f* joke. Anyway, for what I tasted, it was still pretty good, because any normal poutine you eat is good.....still can't get over the fact I paid 36$ for fries lol The mushroom risotto was delicious but the squash spaghetti with a piece of mozzarella on top was awful. I will give this place another chance because I really want to try their real lobster poutine, so i'll definitely come back in the summer. But for the rest, there are sooo many better options in Old Montreal!

Probably the best meal of my life. Obviously the raw bar is a must but the entree was definitely the highlight. Roasted quail w/ foie gras, fiddle heads, morels, caramelized leeks & jus. Incredibly rich but not excessively so. Coffee cake w/ salted caramel brittle and malt ice cream, which of course tasted like frozen Ovaltine, absolutely brilliant. I do want to say that Chuck Hughes is probably the least pretentious celebrity chef on the planet. He was there when we arrived and spent the whole time washing dishes. Probably thought that was the best way he could help and he knew his team had the food handled.Bravo

Went about two weeks ago with the boyfriend and everything was great!For the appetizer I had the duck confit with foie gras served on a waffle with a sweet buttery sauce and it was absolutely delicious. The duck was crispy and the waffle was fluffy and the foie gras seared to perfection. As a main I got the short rib with gouda mashed potatoes and it was also delicious. The meat was very tender and you can tell it was cooked with love.My boyfriend had the beef tartare, which was to die for and the flavors were perfect. A little spicy, creamy and served with toast and house marinated pickles. I couldnt help myself and stole a few bites. His main dish was the pork cheek with clams, also great. It was a little spicy for his taste but if you like it hot, its fine. All the dishes were well balanced and the flavors mixed together perfectly.For desert I had the peanut butter cream puffs which were AMAZING. So soft and moist, they were the best cream puffs I ever had in my life.Wine was great and they have a huge list, and our server was very friendly and knowledgeable. She answered easily to all our questions and offered a great service.Only negative, we ate way too much!Will definitely be going back soon, Chuck definitely lives up to his name!

I was vacationing in Montreal last summer and knew I wanted to check out Garde Manger. I was able to get a reservation for the Saturday night we were in town at 8:30. We arrived and were promptly seated in a huge corner booth. Since I was with my brother and his friend we decided to try a lot of different dishes. My review is a bit overdue, so I don't remember entirely what we ordered but I do remember the lobster poutine and oysters. Both were really good!I would recommend Garde Manger. The service was great and the restaurant has a nice ambiance.

What a great experience! Me and my date came here on a weekend trip to Montreal. Knowing this place was probably booked solid, I got the DINR app and sure enough spotted a reservation for two.Our waiter was hilarious and made the whole meal so enjoyable. They also start you off with some bread and onion butter that was delicious! The waiter boasted the olde fashioned which my date got and thoroughly enjoyed. My Sauvignon blanc was great with my meal. We stared off with the jerk crab which we were told is the only dish that has stayed on the menu throughout the entire 11 years the restaurant has been open! It was delicious but my date who wasn't used to peeling and eating crab found it messy and hard to eat. However, I loved it! For mains, I had the scallop and pork belly in BBQ sauce. Presentation was on point. This was the most delicious thing ever, the scallops were cooked perfectly and paired so well with the pork belly and the corn it was on. Portion was small which is my only negative point, I just wished there was more for how much it cost. We ended off the meal with the peanut butter and chocolate sauce puff pastry, this was okay but my date loved it! What a great evening, would 100% return on my next Montreal visit!

Fantastique! What a place! What ambiance! What food! So glad we went here for dinner. Stunning. Stellar. Great service, tremendous food. Nothing great come cheap. Worth every nickel. Can't wait to return.

It's trendy, loud, and even an excellent restaurant.  Be prepared to wait a bit for your table - whether you have a reservation or not - but ultimately it's worth the wait.  Cocktails were quite good and the wine list was very small print and hard to read in the dark dining area but had a few good selections.  Service was friendly but not very experienced, in general Montreal these days is a young, vibrant city but servers seem to often fall into the young and not all that experienced category.Lobster poutine was good but for $18 I would expect additional lobster or something to better justify the price for poutine.  For the main course we went with two fish dishes and both were cooked perfectly and included accompanying Israeli Couscous and Spatzle along with vegetables and sauces that were excellent and didn't seem overly filling.  Because of this we opted for dessert which was unfortunately a mistake - the clafoutis was not great and the "ice cream sandwich" just didn't work well - all of the components were quite good on their own but when put together the thick, dense, chocolate on either side of the "sandwich" just overpowered everything and made us leave half the dish on the plate.I would return, but be aware that Garde Manger is one of the more expensive restaurants you'll find in Montreal and while it's very good there is definitely room for improvement.  Maybe just don't order dessert as a start.

We had a really excellent experience at the bar.  I did not know anything about Chuck Hughes or the "hype" really, it was recommended by a friend who is a fan and whose taste I trust.  Then I read about the lobster poutine and decided I had to try it.  Well, apparently they took it off the menu at least a year ago LOL!  So while I was initially disappointed, in retrospect I'm so glad it was not on the menu because we tried some wonderful dishes.We were late, missed the little side street and had to backtrack, (ugh I hate that!), but fortunately they did not give away our reservation.  Sam at the bar was super friendly and a perfect salesperson- and I mean that in a good way!  He was an excellent listener and guided us through the menu and what would make sense for us.  We had a seafood tray with razor clams (oh my I had never had these before - a revelation!), smoked mussels - utterly delicious, two oysters (for my husband, I had the mussels, crab that was delectable that we didn't have to work at - meat already picked, and arctic char- another dish I had not tried and now love!  This served with Chuck's own jalepeno hot sauce.  Next we had brussel sprouts with house bacon, hazelnuts Chuck's "bomba" - spicy nuts and probably some other things.  For our entrée we shared the duck leg and duck croquettes.  Absolutely melt in your mouth delicious.  Never had duck in croquette form before and it totally worked.  Hubby was kind enough to give me his duck fat :).  Heaven.  For dessert could not decide between lemon cake and chocolate peanut butter profiteroles, Sam made it easy by giving us the cake and just one profiterole.  Peanut buttery deliciousness, wish we had only gotten those, the lemon cake was good- but... peanut butter!  We each had two cocktails- which were good but not exactly memorable, I can't remember what we got!  The food was definitely the star of the show.  Sam was ready to try to make me an iced tea even though they did not have it- I got another drink instead.   I feel like the meal was really a good value given the unique dishes, presentation and outstanding flavors combined with what I felt was a really good experience.  If you don't drink it will be an even better value :).  They acknowledged that we were celebrating our anniversary too. Would recommend and will definitely return when we go back to Montreal.  Especially since the menu is always changing.  Next time might try the chef's tasting menu.  Go and enjoy!

Gorgeous restaurant in a very charming part of Montreal. The seafood was super fresh and the presentation was on point. Staff were very friendly. Great desserts too so make sure you save room for those!

My wife is a big fan of Chuck Hughes so I surprised her for our anniversary dinner. Although Chuck wasn't in that night, we really enjoyed the food and ambiance. I'm a big fan of seafood, so I ordered a scallop entree, which turned out to be the best scallops  I've ever had. Even my wife who isn't a big fan of scallops loved my entree and said it was possibly one of the best things she's eaten. Awesome and professional service. Highly recommended! Will definitely come back and looking forward to trying Chuck's other restaurant, Le Bremner.

I would like to just leave a Wow here. Easily slides in to my top 3 best meals ever.Takes a bit to find (look for the pink light), but once you're there it's like a party in your buddy's cabin where everyone is just drinkin, munchin and having a good time. The atmosphere is loud, so if you're looking for a quiet romantic spot, Montreal has plenty that suit that purpose, not this one.Chalkboard menu, top is apps, bottom is mains. Server will happily take a picture on your phone for you so you can easily consult it.Started with Rabbit Agnolotti in a dijon cream sauce. I'm a bit of a cuteitarian, so while morally opposed to this dish, thumper was delish.Hubs had the salt cod risotto with lemon and fried capers. I've since decided I've never had a risotto made right before (including my own) and will need to figure out how they got a risotto to be light and not have carb-remorse is a wonder.I had Sturgeon, Pork Belly, Japanese Mushrooms, Egg and Potato Dumplings in a pork broth. I avoid pork like the plague, but I just had to. It didn't look like much food but once you dig in the richness of it all, so ridiculously decadent I had to restrain myself from licking the bowl. Every component sung on its own merit but was a beautiful choir with the rest. The simple addition of a couple of hot pepper rings on the sturgeon cut through the richness and provided another layer of flavor.To finish up, we had the PB & J Profiteroles.
